data.text:
OPINION is divided over whether Sid Luft revived the career of former child star Judy Garland, after becoming her third husband in 1952, or whether he was just a charming chancer who milked her for all she was worth. Despite being the principal producer on the 1954 film A Star is Born â€” for which Garland was nominated for the best actress Oscar, Luft failed to build a career in the film business and in recent years he had a running battle with the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences over his attempts to sell the miniature Academy Award she had received for The Wizard of Oz.
